comment: Take this professor if you need to take IS2200. Professor Hedricks was very responsive and understanding. Her grading rubrics are very clear, and she is an easy grader. She understands that life happens and was willing to provide extension on assignments. As any college course, just make sure you do the work!!
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: She is very accessible and basically instantly replies to emails. She wants to get to know her students. Her feedback on assignments is very helpful, you'll know exactly where you went wrong. Rubrics are very clear for everything. TAKE HER.
Great professor. Super nice and helpful. Records her own lectures and updates. Choose this professor if you have the chance.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is an amazing professor, she's easily reached via email and is very forgiving on assignments. Both exams are on lockdown browser no webcam. She wants you to succeed.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: She is such a goated professor! There is a lot of work every week, that's just how the course is, but it's manageable. She has a week-long grace period for assignments. All the quizzes are no lockdown browser or webcam. The tests are lockdown browser, but NO webcam. Everything is done through McGraw-Hill!! Easy A. Take this professor if you can!

If you want an easy A, take this class! There's a week grace period for every single assignment, which are weekly open-note quizzes with 10 questions. The occasional Excel assignments are a breeze. Midterm and final are open-note with a webcam/lockdown browser, but every question is from the quizzes, so I knew every question when taking.
Professor Hedrick was very good at understanding students' needs and responding in a timely manner. IS2200 is a very cool class, as it incorporated AI and 3D printing.

Weekly textbook homework and quiz, a midterm and final with lockdown about 50 questions each in 50 minutes. Great extra credit opportunities and straightforward grading policy. Participation and involvement matters.  1 group project and 5 iEngage meetings to attend which are super informative. Professor Hendrick is Amazing, just do your part!
rating_tags: Group projects--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: Take her if you want an easy A!!! Weekly quizzes(10 questions super easy) 2 exams lockdown no camera. One week grace period on every assignment except the 2 exams! 1 excel project. A group project which requires presenting luckily it's a recorded presentation so only your group members and teacher see it!! TAKE HER!!! I would 100% take her again!

I loved Prof. Hedrick. Her weekly videos going over everything we'd be doing was very helpful. It didn't really feel like a lecture and more of her recounting her day. My favorite part of the class was the week-long grace period she had for every assignment.

Prof Hedrick is amazing and kind. A week's work normally includes reading out of the required textbook as well as quiz and sometimes a short lab which uses a virtual machine. There are 3 exams 1 being the final. Exams are lockdown no webcam and quizzes are not lockdown. Attendance is part of your grade. Overall the class is an easy A.
Easily one of the best professors at KSU, she genuinely cares for her students and wants the best for them. She is kind and caring, and is also very accessible outside of class! Take her!
Amazing professor and class. Take it if you want an easy A. Stress free class!
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I took her hybrid class, she really does care about her students. Learning materials accessible online, lecture slides, how to videos made by the TA if you need extra help also has ISENG meetings in class. 1 virtual group presentation easy to do. Drops lowest grade, extends all deadlines to an extra week, exams lockdown. You do need the textbooks.

There is a lot of homework you have to read and take quizzes every week as well as sometimes he does other assignments that also take forever to do. Her lectures are all on PowerPoint but she does have an attendance grade so you have to go. It's pretty easy if you do everything on time. only two tests on locked-down browser.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: If I could take her for every class here I would.Attendance is mandatory, but I had an 8 am class and I was excited to go to it and could pay attention. Not to mention the work is so easy and she gives a one-week grace period for everything! She also does a check-in every morning to answer questions and to check up on all of her students.

If you fail her class, drop out. One week grace period for all assignments. Is willing to help you all the time on absolutely anything you need. Includes Midterm and Final, easy Group Project, an Excel project, weekly quizzes in Connect, and a handful of assignments. The single most caring and kind professor I have ever had.

Prof Hedrick is super sweet, her lectures are attendance mandatory but she's great & has a soothing voice so you'll enjoy them. Tests are lockdown browser no webcam, she allows you to submit work if you forgot to, and very accessible through email. Speakers come into the class, from diff. companies (networking opportunities). Taker her for an A!!

She really cares about the success of her students and is extremely sweet and helpful. Could not have asked for a better professor for this class. There's no way you will do bad in this class as long as you put fourth the effort and ask for help when you need it.

Great professor, and an easy class overall. Weekly discussions and quizzes which are only a lockdown browser. Two exams, midterm and final which are only lockdown browsers. There is an online training course but that is easy.  Also, she gives one-week grace periods on most assignments.

Pro. Hedrick is amazing! She is such a kind and caring prof. She lays everything out and only wants her students to succeed. Attendance is kinda mandatory, as she does a QR code and has 5 daily questions. There's one group project and you don't have to present in front of the class!!!!! I highly recommend taking her!
Amazing professor!! She was always there if anybody needed help understanding and truly made this class enjoyable! Could not recommend a professor enough!!
Professor Hedrick is such a sweet woman. She always tried to make class entertaining and encouraged participation in a non-forceful, low key way. Very easy to listen to and very knowledgeable.

Hedrick is my favorite professor in ksu and is a 10/10 choice for any class she teaches. she doesn't penalize for late submissions and curves your grade. She is so understanding and responds quickly whenever you have questions. There's weekly quizzes and assignments, a group presentation and two exams and lots of extra credits. Take her !!!

She is a nice and understanding professor best hands down. 1 week grace period is given for all assignment, no points deducted she understands that life simply just gets hectic. For exams notes were allowed, she follows up with everyone every week with her videos. She also answers emails in a timely manner. I honestly would take her again.

There is not a better professor at KSU. She's kind, caring, and passionate. She gives a 1-week grace period (No points deducted) for EVERY assignment. She does kahoots for tests (notes allowed) and has no attendance policy. Her lectures are awesome and she is just one of the greatest professors I've ever taken. This is a no question asked, take.

She is such a sweet professor! She is approachable, and answers email on time. I took this course during the Spring semester, and she kept us regularly updated about upcoming due dates. She is kind and understanding too.

Professor Hedrick is such a sweet, caring and enthusiastic person! This was an online summer course but she always kept the class updated and provided grace periods without penalty. She was very understanding and nice. She definitely knows her stuff!

Amazing professor/Highly recommend. Weekly quizzes with unlimited attempts, however they were timed. Study the material for a better understanding. Tests were based off quizzes. Labs were pretty straightforward. Pace everything right and this class will be a breeze. Hardest assignment was the recent event (1500 word minimum) so don't procrastinate.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: Pretty solid professor. Definitely nice and makes class easy to go to but there are a few homework assignments a week. They aren't too difficult but take time so don't wait until late to do them. Tests are easy and based on the weekly quizzes.

ISA 3100: Honestly one of the best professors I've ever had. She is super caring and understanding, she will work with you to help you get your class work done. She will usually let you turn something in late if you have a valid reason. Professor Hedrick is very approachable outside of class, she will not let you do bad in the class.

ISA 3100: Love Love Love Alison!!!!! She is literally the kindest professor I have ever met!! She curved our exam scores, offered extra credit opportunities, and is super understanding! Quizzes are online and unlimited attempts, exams are online and 1 attempt with webcam due to the board (she tried to change it but couldn't). 10/10 take her!!!

Super sweet and responsive. Never hesitates to answer your questions. Assignments are tough but she goes through them before they are due. Quizzes and tests are challenging but they don't make up majority of your grade. She is the best option in my opinion!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria

comment: I loved this professor, and it was one of my favorite classes. The workload is not heavy at all and easily manageable. She is so understanding and responds quickly whenever you have questions. There's a quiz every week with several assignments, a group presentation and two exams. Really would recommend!!

Professor Hedrick is the best! The class involves a lot of reading and quizzes, but they aren't difficult if you understand the material. There are 4 assignments that she explains in detail and they are pretty easy if you show up to class. If you can, I would definitely take her!!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Hedrick is a 10/10 choice for any Cybersecurity class, hands down. Her instructions are always clear and if you by chance don't understand, she's available through email and isn't rude. Her class isn't exactly easy but it's far from demanding and annoying.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very clear and easy to follow instructions for quizzes, discussion posts, etc. Grade was made up mostly of weekly quizzes based on lectures and readings, and discussion posts were short and based on articles you chose yourself on the internet. By far one of the best online classes I've ever had to take.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: One of the best professors Ive had thus far in my college career. Shes very engaging and cares that you pass the course. Also very understanding if you have to miss class (with good reasoning). Highly recommended! Be sure to show up to class though, she will explain many of the assignments in easy to understand detail.
Professor Alison Hedrick is amazing

This class was one of the most difficult I've taken at Kennesaw State. I'm not much of a technophile and I will warn any similar to me to be wary of this course. There were multiple programs used within the class and some were very difficult to understand and work with. She does give a significant bump for grades but her assessments were HARD.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: Prof. Hedrick is SUPER nice!! She responded to all of my emails and she offered back points on projects that you didn't do well on if you emailed her. She makes you do 19 quizzes, 4 discussions, 7 assignments, a midterm, group project, and a final. It's a lot, but she is more than willing to help you succeed. Take her if you want to put in the work

An absolutely lovely teacher. Information Systems is a tough class but she makes it easier. Lots of work because it is a tedious class but it is not hard work. There are a lot of projects but if you email her she will help you out a lot. 11/10 professor. Information System 3/10 tough class but she's super helpful.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: Professor Hedrick is very caring of her students and will help you out. She gives great feedback on projects. You can skip up to 4 times before your grades drops but she is very understandable. Weekly quizzes but lets you use the online textbook on her D2L during the 15min of quiz time.

Professor Hedrick made a difficult class seem not so bad at all. Very clear on instructions, and goes over what is to be expected for every assignment. She is very caring and wants all of her students to pass. I highly recommend you take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Professor Hedrick is one of the most caring and passionate teachers I have ever had at KSU. She loves all of her students and will do whatever it takes to help them. Attendence is not mandatory but there is a small grade taken each class which will add up if you don't attend. 10/10 recommend

She seems sweet but she's a tough grader. I took this as a hybrid. Attendance is mandatory, I missed two and got an 86. She loves group projects but grades so harshly. She took off 25 points once for not taking a selfie. Quizzes you can use the textbook online, super easy just look it up. She's nice but takes the class too serious.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Prof. Hedrick is a great professor and one of the kindest people I have ever met. She cares about students and genuinely wants them to succeed and learn. She will work with you to help you understand what you don't. Her classes are usually fun and interesting, even though I would not probably be interested if anyone else taught the class.

She will give you a ton of busy work. Be prepared for a lot of work in this class. The tests are timed and you are given a very brief period of time to complete them. Not open book and they are hard. Sometimes she will re-word things to make it even more challenging. I suggest you do not take a full time load of classes while taking this class.

Professor Hedrick is the absolute best professor I have had yet at KSU. I only wish I had taken this course on campus. The last few projects are a bit tough but overall the course is great! On a few occasions she even walked me through my errors (what professor does that anymore?) She is a sweet woman, do yourself a favor and take her course! AA++

Professor Hedrick is probably the sweetest professor at KSU. She is so willing to work with students, and you can tell that she really wants everyone to succeed. I took her class as a hybrid, and although it's not necessarily hard, there are weekly assignments & modules that take some time to complete. If you put a little effort in, you'll get an A

I took this as a hybrid class. I learned a lot, but there was a lot of work. I did Excel and access assignment, weird quizzes and tests, made a website, learned how to protect my computer and personal information, etc. Professor Hedrick was very nice and helpful. She takes attendance through group activities during class.
She is totally awesome and sweet. very easy as long as read you read assigned material. She is very involved and loves to help and very quick to respond to emails. I learned a lot from taking her.

She is a very caring professor. She is understanding, gracious, and kind. I really enjoyed having her as a professor; the material just wasn't my thing. Do all the assignments, read the readings before quizzes, and be prepared for the TWO exams because they are challenging.

The most caring professor I've had to date. She gives grace upon grace upon grace. She will take her time and answer students, and give them the benefit of the doubt in most situations. If you do an assignment incorrectly, or forget to do something she was always good about working with you. SHE IS AMAZING. You'd be crazy not to take her.

really sweet professor. VERY organized. the weekly modules usually look like: reading, lesson, quiz, discussion, participation discussion, and some sort of assignment. the quizzes can be rough because they cover so much. SO MUCH READING. 2 tests. a group project (not hard at all). would recommend.

I absolutely love how organized this class is. She sends weekly emails, has weekly schedules posted, is prompt with grading, and always responds to emails quickly. She is so sweet, and has pretty interesting lectures as well. You will get a good grade if you do your work. Great professor!

She is such a nice, understanding, and helpful professor.  Do the work and you will do fine.  She sometimes has you do the assignments in class and will help you.  She wants you to succeed and will ensure you do.  She is nice so be nice to her! She is chill and patient and makes the class fun.

Best online prof I've ever had! There's a lot of busy work, but it's all easy. She provides a ton of extra credit with the weekly optional discussions, making it virtually impossible to get below an A! She's super quick at responding to e-mails and is very lenient with the grading for SIMnet assignments. If you need to take this class, take her!

The most amazing teacher ever! She takes the most complicated things and break them to where you can understand it. Very approachable and nice. If you need to take this class, I strongly recommend her.

She's a super sweet teacher. There's a lot of busy work, but it's totally do-able. If it's a class required for your major like it was for me, you should definitely take her because it's a really easy A.

Way too much work for perhaps the most useless, uninteresting class I've ever taken. Weekly quizzes and modules. Spent a few weeks studying for more important classes and missed a few quizzes, and despite having high grades on other assigments, made a low grade.   Thought it'd' be a good class as a CS major. Wrong. Basically a MS Excel how to.
A ton of work, so keep up.

ONLINE CLASS. Great professor. Really cares that students have a good online experience. Gives leniency when appropriate because of electronic format. ETextbook not user friendly. Since there are no class meetings, take this class with a friend so that you have a study buddy and you will not regret it. Excel section is time consuming, but not hard

TAKE HER! I took it online. She's great, I don't like the material but she made as fun and interesting as she could. She's so helpful and so sweet! It's a lot of work but definitely doable, I just committed one day a week to do the work and that was plenty.
Online course- Can't stand the material (Yuk!) but... if you like learning about technology and are interested in going into this field then GREAT professor, easy course!

Great online teacher. She wants you to succeed. She makes herself available and if you miss an assignment, she will usually allow you to make it up. Expensive textbook but you MUST have it to make any kind of grade in the course. Very easy if you simply take the quiz with the textbook open. Easy assignments too, but they can get tedious.

I had Mrs. Hedrick for an online class, and she was the best online professor I've ever had. She responded to emails, she gave clear instructions. Easy A if you do the work and keep up with the assignments. I wish there were more professors like Mrs. Hedrick.

She's so sweet! And she is incredibly helpful. She really wants you to enjoy what you're learning. Only complaint is that she relies too heavily on the e-text and a computer program called SAM for all assignments, both of which I found replete with errors and not always easy to understand or use. Otherwise, though, she's a great teacher.

She is a really sweet instructor.  Always available to answer questions.  This class is an easy A if you are computer literate.  If you need some help with computers I highly recommend taking this class - it will help.  Workload wasn't too bad, Weekly assignments, quizzes discussions and mid-term and final.
TAKE HER! She is very helpful with anything you ask her about. The class is very straight forward, you are just learning about computers. WONDERFUL TEACHER!!
Awesome teacher. Take her if you can. Very helpful and nice.

She's an awesome professor. I hate the subject matter and took the same class last semester with McPherson (what a joke) and had to repeat the course. I expected to hate every moment of it but Hedrick made it very easy and enjoyable. Def take her if you can!
Such a nice person. She's new at teaching and just graduated not long ago so she's a little nervous but such a pleasant person to have as a professor! Def take her if you can!
